content.description:
Turnus’s Fate is Determined

Stetit acer in armis
Aeneas volvens oculos dextramque repressitreprimo, -ere, -pressi = premo, -ere; 
et iam iamqueiam iamque = “again and again” magis cunctantem flectere sermo
coeperat, infelix umero cum apparuit alto 

Line 5balteusbalteus, -i, m.: sword belt et notis fulseruntfulgeo, -ere, fulsi: to flash cingulacingulum, -i, n.: belt bullisbulla, -ae, f.: knob 
Pallantis pueri, victum quem vulnere Turnus 
straverat atque umeris inimicum insigneinimicum insigne = “the mark of his enemy” gerebat.

Aeneid 12.938-944
content.question: Translate the passage as literally as possible.

frqParts.text: Translate the passage as literally as possible.

unit.text: 5: Vergil's Aeneid, Excerpts from Books 4, 6, 7, 11, and 12
